headline.print_headline: In the West, A Full Eclipse
headline.seo: N.B.A. Playoffs: In the West, a Full Eclipse
headline.main: In the West, a Full Eclipse

docs.snippet: The Lakers are left to pick up the pieces after they were eliminated from the N.B.A. playoffs by Oklahoma City....
docs.abstract: Howard Beck On Pro Basketball column holds that the Los Angeles Lakers are left to pick up the pieces after being eliminated from the NBA playoffs by Oklahoma City Thunder; suggests that while the team's core has helped win titles, it is now in need of another rejuvenation.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Lakers are left to pick up the pieces after they were eliminated from the N.B.A. playoffs by Oklahoma City.

headline.print_headline: Secret Service Director to Testify That Security Was Not Breached in Scandal
headline.main: Secret Service Director to Testify That Security Was Not Breached in Scandal

docs.snippet: Testimony Wednesday for a Senate committee in Washington will be the director’s first public comments on the prostitution scandal in Colombia last month....
docs.abstract: Secret Service Director Mark Sullivan, appearing before Congress, is expected to testify that the Colombia prostitution scandal did not result in a breach of national security.
docs.lead_paragraph: Testimony Wednesday for a Senate committee in Washington will be the director’s first public comments on the prostitution scandal in Colombia last month.

headline.print_headline: Even When His Latino Roots May Aid Politically, Rangel Keeps Them Buried
headline.seo: Rangel Prefers to Keep His Hispanic Roots Buried
headline.main: Even When His Latino Roots Might Help Politically, Rangel Keeps Them Buried

docs.snippet: Representative Charles B. Rangel said he would rather not talk about his Puerto Rican father, who beat his mother and abandoned the family....
docs.abstract: Rep Charles B Rangel's Puerto Rican heritage may aid him politically as he seeks re-election in a Congressional district that, as a result of reapportionment, has a Latino majority for the first time.

byline.contributor: Jack Styczynski and Kate Taylor contributed reporting.

docs.lead_paragraph: Representative Charles B. Rangel said he would rather not talk about his Puerto Rican father, who beat his mother and abandoned the family.

headline.print_headline: Eugene Polley, Conjuror of a Device That Changed TV Habits, Dies at 96
headline.seo: Eugene Polley, Inventor of the Wireless TV Remote, Dies at 96
headline.main: Eugene Polley, Conjuror of a Device That Changed TV Habits, Dies at 96

docs.snippet: Mr. Polley, a Zenith engineer, invented the Flash-Matic remote control for television, and spent years reminding people he was the device’s sole inventor....
docs.abstract: Eugene Polley, inventor of the wireless television remote control, dies at age 96.
docs.lead_paragraph: Mr. Polley, a Zenith engineer, invented the Flash-Matic remote control for television, and spent years reminding people he was the device’s sole inventor.

headline.print_headline: In Remote Alaska, Financing Puts a Rare Refuge at Risk
headline.seo: In Remote Alaska, Women Risk Losing Rare Refuge
headline.main: In Remote Alaska, Financing Puts a Rare Refuge at Risk

docs.snippet: The Emmonak Women’s Shelter in Alaska, uniquely situated in a Native American village, needs more money to survive beyond this summer....
docs.abstract: Emmonak Women's Shelter in Alaska is the state's only center for abused women situated in an Alaska Native village, but will most likely be closed due to the state's elimination of financing for rural services for Alaska Natives in 2005.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Emmonak Women’s Shelter in Alaska, uniquely situated in a Native American village, needs more money to survive beyond this summer.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Files Suit Against Jobs Agency Used by City
headline.seo: U.S. Files Fraud Lawsuit Against Seedco, Jobs Agency
headline.main: U.S. Files Suit Against Jobs Agency Used by City

docs.snippet: Federal officials found that Seedco, once favored by the Bloomberg administration as an employment finder, had filed hundreds of fake job placement reports....
docs.abstract: Federal prosecutors file multimillion-dollar lawsuit against nonprofit agency Seedco; suit claims that contractor received more than $8 million in federal money to operate job placement centers in New York City, and reported hundreds, and most likely thousands, of fake job placements over three years.
docs.lead_paragraph: Federal officials found that Seedco, once favored by the Bloomberg administration as an employment finder, had filed hundreds of fake job placement reports.

headline.print_headline: Iran Recalls Its Ambassador From Azerbaijan
headline.seo: After Protests, Iran Recalls Ambassador From Azerbaijan
headline.main: Iran Recalls Its Ambassador From Azerbaijan

docs.snippet: The ambassador in Baku was summoned home amid a series of protests and rising tensions over matters as varied as weapons purchases and the Eurovision song contest....
docs.lead_paragraph: The ambassador in Baku was summoned home amid a series of protests and rising tensions over matters as varied as weapons purchases and the Eurovision song contest.

headline.main: Binghamton Basketball Team to Hire Coach

docs.snippet: Binghamton is on the verge of hiring Rider Coach Tommy Dempsey, according to a person with direct knowledge of the hiring....

keywords.value: State University of New York at Binghamton
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Binghamton is expected to hire Tommy Dempsey as its men's basketball coach.
docs.lead_paragraph: Binghamton is on the verge of hiring Rider Coach Tommy Dempsey, according to a person with direct knowledge of the hiring.

headline.print_headline: U.S. Sees Other Countries Luring Expatriates to Return
headline.main: U.S. Sees Other Countries Luring Expatriates to Return

docs.snippet: A report released by an immigration group was broadly critical of the American immigration system, which it said is slow, inflexible and not synchronized with the nation’s labor needs....

keywords.value: Partnership for a New American Economy
keywords.name: organizations

docs.abstract: Partnership for a New American Economy report says the United States is facing intense competition from foreign countries, especially China, that are seeking to persuade highly skilled citizens who have settled in the US to return home to start businesses; the report contends the US immigration system is slow, inflexible and not synchronized with the nation's labor needs.
docs.lead_paragraph: A report released by an immigration group was broadly critical of the American immigration system, which it said is slow, inflexible and not synchronized with the nation’s labor needs.

docs.snippet: Reform on a well-thought-out timetable must be distinguished from reform done in extreme haste....
docs.abstract: Op-Ed article by Nobel laureate and author Amartya Sen suggests the most troubling aspect of Europe's malaise may be the replacement of democratic commitments by financial dictates from the European Union and the European Central Bank, and indirectly from credit-rating agencies; warns Europe cannot revive itself without addressing the political legitimacy of these dictates, many of which are ineffective and unjust.
docs.lead_paragraph: Reform on a well-thought-out timetable must be distinguished from reform done in extreme haste.
